args: S-sir! Did you see that, sir? I did it!
How grand to see you finally manage to\nperform even the most rudimentary task.
Still, I suppose it is enough for me to\nassign your first duty as a Templar.
Your task will be to serve as escort for an\nimportant man traveling by horse and cart\nto the central diocese.
Know that I will be watching—and\njudging—your performance most closely.
Do you feel yourself above such a task?
Are you kidding me? I'm THRILLED!\nIt feels like I've been training forever,\nand I'm ready for some real action!
Yes, well, keep up that positive attitude.\nNow then, the man you are escorting is...
Don't be TOO strict with our new recruits\nnow, Tobias, or we may find ourselves\ncompletely bereft of them.
Hope, this is your charge for today:\nHis Grace Archbishop Bern.
Th-the Archbishop?! Er, I mean,\nI'm Hope, Your Grace!

H-how positively awe-inspiring for a
priest like me, the lowest of the low,
to meet you, Your Grace! ...Er, wait.
I suppose I'm more of a knight today.
The priest who would be a knight, eh?\nI've heard tell of you, son—is it true\nyou wish to become a Heavenwing?
If so, it's no wonder our dear Tobias\nis working you with such vigor.
It is time to depart, Your Grace.\nThe cart is just over there.
Ah, yes. Of course. Time and tide\nwait for no man, it seems.
...Therefore, I would have us endeavor\nto make the central diocese our forces'\nfocal point.

And yet, to do that would magnify even
more the damage to the surrounding areas,
abasing the authority of the Church in the
eyes of her people...
They've been talking serious business\never since we set out on the road.
I guess I expected a bodyguard job to\ninvolve more... I dunno. Bodyguarding?
Oh well! I should probably just be\ngrateful for a soft first landing and—
Right. Time for Hope the Templar\nto snap into action!
Ha! That's the power of training for you!
If I can keep doing great work like this,\nI'm gonna be an AMAZING Templar!
Oh, heck! Where'd that guy come from?!\nWelp, no choice but to take it on...
Okay, that hurt... Hurt a lot, actually...\nBut there's no way I'm gonna give up!
Fool of a boy! You are no match for a foe\nof this strength! Why did you not call for\naid the moment you saw it?!
Bah. I see now this was a fool's errand.\nNow ready yourself and do as I say!
*pant* *wheeze* Well, that was a lot more\nexciting than maybe I needed it to be,\nbut I managed to carry out my duty.
Fine job, my lad! Fine job indeed.\nYou've energy to spare for certain.
I expect great things from you.\n...Tobias, see to it we continue to\nrecruit useful additions such as he.
Ah, but I'm afraid I must say my farewells\nand hurry along to my meeting. Ta-ta!
Yesss! I got complimented\nby the Archbishop himself!
He recognized my determination!\nI am SO happy right now!
If I keep working hard like this, I know I'll\nbecome a knight who can save everyone!
I really worked hard today, didn't I, sir?\nOh, and I passed the assignment, right?

The fact you do not know makes me worry
all the more. You overestimated your
strength, boy, and in doing so showed
a most critical lack of judgment.

True, you completed the escort safely.
However, you foolishly chose to take
on an enemy well above your level,
and did not think to summon aid.

To risk one's life without a semblance of a
plan is not bravery, but base recklessness.
Such is not an action befitting a knight
of our sacred order.
I fear you may forever lack the wisdom\nto serve as one of Ilia's vanguard.
Is that a quivering lip I see before me?\nDo you plan to abandon your cause now?
...No. In fact, I'm going to work\nTWICE as hard as before.
I'm going to keep working until I\nprove my value to you!
A lukewarm passion is worse than none\nat all, and my passion is BOILING hot!
Well, I can't just sit around here twiddling\nmy priestly thumbs—I'm gonna go run\nlaps until I puke, then do it some more!
I have not the slightest idea if he\nunderstood my concerns or not.

As a knight of Ilia, your judgment will only
be further called into question from this
point on. Both what you believe in...
and who you align with.
